page.title: 19THE MAYOR OF TAMESIDE (cont)
page.content: position of Mayor but when all his children were married and his wife Mildred was no longer working, he was able to accept the nomination and became Mayor of Tameside on 22nd May 1984. During his Year of Office he had 683 engagements the first being Weldems Mossley 25th Anniversary. He found all his engagements enjoyable the most memorable being the visit to Buckingham Palace and the Papal Blessing he received. As Mayor he raised Â£19,000 for his nominated charity, the Mentally Handicapped of Tameside. His last official engagement was on the 21st May 1985 at the Professional Women's Association when he and his wife, could at last shed the weight of both Office and the chains of solid gold which are insured for Â£170,000.
